column4: if you do what it's telling you to do, and don't mess it up; and if the instructions do what the instructions claim to; then it should not affect your windows install.

I'd be making backups of everything just in case, and get the correct flashing software for the BIOS (assuming/hoping that the affected code is part of that flashing, which you'd expect I guess) and take a flash-tool based backup of the BIOS as well as a backup of the file you edit in Linux.
I figured it would not, since it compiles on Linux.
